There are 3 historic districts in Mott Haven: Mott Haven, Mott Haven East and the Bertine Block. The historic districts preserve brick rowhouses of the Italiante, neo-Grecian and other styles. Some artists and professionals have been moving into lofts and historic brownstones in these areas, along with a small concentration of new restaurants and cafes. An Antiques District has grown along Bruckner Boulevard and Alexander Avenue, in sight of the old piano and other factories. Recently, the city has rezoned former commercial areas in and near Mott Haven for mixed-use and residential occupation, and additional abandoned commercial buildings are now in the process of being converted into residential lofts<ref>Hughes, C.J.
